answers.answer: Hello,From the symptoms it looks like a urinary tract infection. Drink plenty of water and fluids and get a urine examination and culture done. Other possibilities are diabetes insipidus, glomerulonephritis, pyelonephritis(inflammation of the kidneys), hypercalcemia, hypokalemia(low potassium),hyperthyroidism, urethral syndrome, hyperparathyroidism and diuretic drugs.For this is suggest you to consult a physician and get urine culture done. I hope it helps. Take care and regards.

question: hi im a 22 yr old female i have had two children the youngest is almost 2 now and lately i have been urinating often and even after i go i stand up from the toilet and i feel i need to urinate again............. its becoming a huge problem as i feel i can not leave the house.i drink 4 coffees a day and hot chocolate at night i don't drink 2hr before i sleep but i am still getting up every 10 minutes to pee.i can not ignore it either or i dribble.it does not burn to pee nor do i have trouble starting or stopping flow mid-flow......... but once my bladder feels empty i can relax and more comes out.what is wrong with me this has been happening for a month now.i have not changed anything in my diet.
title: need to pee.
